oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Rural schools; Public schools; Educational facilities
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two entrances flanked by windows are visible in this front view of Mt. Zion Hebrew Colored School. Two white men wearing straw hats are standing in the front yard. In the distance are cattle and trees.

The Julius Rosenwald Fund was one of the private Northern philanthropic foundations that operated in Tennessee to aid the cause of black education. Fayette County received $13,000 from the Fund for school construction by July 1, 1930. For Mt. Zion Hebrew Colored Consolidated School, Rosenwald contributed $700; public funds contributed $1,500; and black donors contributed $1,300.
